paper_abstract: The use of pairings has been shown promising for many two-party and three-party identity-based authenticated key agreement protocols. In recent years, several identity-based authenticated key agreement protocols have been proposed and most of them broken. in this paper, we propose two three-party identity-based authenticated key agreement protocols applying bilinear pairings. We show that the proposed protocols are secure (i.e. conform to defined security attributes) while being efficient. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Two proposed identity-based three-party authenticated key agreement protocols from pairings
